enWisdom: Excessive speech is annoying

Wisdom: الْكَلَامُ بَيْنَ خَلَّتَيْ سَوْءٍ هُمَا الْإِكْثَارُ وَالْإِقْلَالُ فَالْإِكْثَارُ هَذْرٌ وَالْإِقْلَالُ عِيٌّ وَحَصَرٌ [وَ الْعُقُوبَةُ وَالِانْتِقَامُ‏]
enWisdom: Speech is between two bad qualities, namely: too much and too little; too much [of it] is babble and too little is inarticulateness and speechlessness

Wisdom: الْإِكْثَارُ يُزِلُّ الْحَكِيمَ وَيَمَلُّ الْحَلِيمَ فَلَا تُكْثِرْ فَتُضْجِرْ وَتُفَرِّطْ [وَ لَا تُفَرِّطْ] فَتُهَنْ
enWisdom: Speaking too much makes the wise one stumble and makes the tolerant one weary, therefore do not talk so much that others get fed up and do not be so reticent that you are humiliated
Haughtiness is the language of error and ignorance

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَكَثْرَةَ الْكَلَامِ فَإِنَّهُ يُكْثِرُ الزَّلَلَ وَيُورِثُ الْمَلَلَ
enWisdom: Beware of excessive speech for indeed it increases errors and brings about weariness

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَفُضُولَ الْكَلَامِ فَإِنَّهُ يُظْهِرُ مِنْ عُيُوبِكَ مَا بَطَنَ وَيُحَرِّكُ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَعْدَائِكَ مَا سَكَنَ
enWisdom: Beware of excessive [and impertinent] speech, for indeed it manifests your hidden flaws and provokes your silent enemies

Wisdom: أَقْبَحُ مِنَ الْعِيِّ الزِّيَادَةُ عَلَى الْمَنْطِقِ عَنْ مَوْضِعِ الْحَاجَةِ
enWisdom: It is worse than inarticulateness for one to speak more than [what] is necessary
The bane of speech is prolongation
Superfluity [in speech] is one of the worst habits

Wisdom: دَعِ الْكَلَامَ فِيمَا لَا يَعْنِيكَ وَفِي غَيْرِ مَوْضِعِهِ فَرُبَّ كَلِمَةٍ سَلَبَتْ نِعْمَةَّ وَلَفْظَةٍ أَتَتْ عَلَى مُهْجَةٍ
enWisdom: Eschew speech about that which does not concern you, and in situations that are inappropriate, for many a word has taken away a blessing and [many] an utterance has brought about bloodshed
Many an utterance is hurtful

Wisdom: عَلَامَةُ الْعِيِّ تَكْرَارُ الْكَلَامِ عِنْدَ الْمُنَاظَرَةِ وَكَثْرَةُ التَّبَجُّحِ عِنْدَ الْمُحَاوَرَةِ
enWisdom: The sign of inarticulateness is repeating oneself during a debate and increased excitement during conversation
Loquaciousness has been paired up with boredom
Too much talking makes the ear weary
Too much asking leads to restlessness
Excessive talking makes one’s brothers fed up

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ الْكَلَامِ تَبْسُطُ حَوَاشِيَهُ وَتَنْقُصُ مَعَانِيَهُ فَلَا يُرَى لَهُ أَمَدٌ وَلَا يَنْتَفِعُ بِهِ أَحَدٌ [أجل‏]
enWisdom: Excessive speech is such that its marginal issues are expanded and its meanings are reduced, so no end is seen for it and nobody benefits from it
One who increases [his talk] makes others weary
One who is loquacious is abandoned
One who talks too much makes others fed up
One who speaks too much [makes] blunders
One who speaks too much gets rebuked more
One whose speech is excessive, his lapses increase
One who talks a lot increases his babble

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَ مَقَالُهُ لَمْ يَعْدَمِ السَّقَطَ
enWisdom: One whose speech is excessive is never free from lapses
Whoever speaks too much, others get fed up with him

Wisdom: مَنْ أَطَالَ الْحَدِيثَ فِيمَا لَا يَنْبَغِي فَقَدْ عَرَّضَ نَفْسَهُ لِلْمَلَامَةِ
enWisdom: One who prolongs his talk about that which he ought not to [speak of] has indeed made himself liable to dispraise

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَ كَلَامُهُ كَثُرَ لَغَطُهُ وَمَنْ كَثُرَ هَزْلُهُ كَثُرَ سُخْفُهُ
enWisdom: One who talks a lot increases his babble and one who jokes a lot increases his silliness
